page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: Most farms in the block are small and run on a{family basis.}The climate and soils both favour grass and{dairy {farming}has been the norm for some time. CASE STUDIES: {Wolversleigh Farm _ Owner B. Beviss 100acres, 50milking Jersey Cows, 18acres of corn for silage, 3bulls and 24goats, farm run by Mr. Beviss his wife and sons. {Sandcombe Farm _}M.W. Tucker, 150Ac. is worked in conjunction with Lower Knapp farm. 140{Beef cattle}(Hereford cross Frisian), 300{sheep,}some 40Ac. {hardwood}forest. Recently the dairy herd was sold due to{E.E.C.}milk {quotas. {Sand Farm _}350Ac. 120 Frisians and 130 sheep,{wheat, barley and roots. Three full time workers employed. Grass is the main land use on most farms along with silage, hay and roots
